It began on September 28, 1990, and ended on March 17, 1991. The playoff rounds began on March 22 and ended on April 14, 1991. The season saw a total of eight teams competing in the league, with the top six advancing to the playoffs. The teams included Klagenfurt AC, EC VSV, Wiener EV, EC KAC, EC Graz, Innsbrucker EV, EHC Lustenau, and EK Zell am See. Klagenfurt AC finished in first place, winning 37 out of 36 games, while EC VSV and Wiener EV finished second and third, respectively. In the playoffs, Klagenfurt AC, EC VSV, and Wiener EV all advanced to the semifinals. The semifinals were played in a best-of-three format, with Klagenfurt AC defeating Wiener EV and EC VSV defeating EC KAC. text: However, the Japanese forces were eventually overwhelmed by the better-equipped and more numerous American forces, and the Thirty-First Army was dissolved in August 1945, just before the end of the war.
target: Please tell me about Thirty-First Army (Japan)
prefix: The Thirty-First Army was a field army of the Imperial Japanese Army during the Second World War. It was formed in September 1944 in the Philippines and was tasked with the defense of the Visayas region, a group of islands in the central Philippines. The army was also responsible for maintaining communication lines to the Japanese fleet and providing support to the naval forces in the area. The Thirty-First Army was under the command of Lt. General Suzuki Sōsaku and was composed of several divisions, including the 102nd Infantry Division, 103rd Infantry Division, and the 68th Independent Mixed Brigade. These forces were made up of a mix of veteran soldiers and poorly trained conscripts. At the time of its formation, the Thirty-First Army faced a difficult situation. American forces had already landed on several islands in the Philippines, and the army was short of supplies and reinforcements. Despite this, the army was able to mount a strong defense of the Visayas region, using a combination of fortifications, guerrilla tactics, and amphibious assaults.

He was born on 14 April 1819 in Hildburghausen, and grew up in the court of his father, who was a strong patron of the arts and culture. In 1843, Prince Albert married Princess Marie of Prussia, the daughter of Prince Wilhelm of Prussia. The couple had six children together, including Princess Victoria Adelaide of Schleswig-Holstein, who would go on to become Queen of Sweden. Prince Albert was a distinguished military commander, and fought in the wars of Schleswig and Holstein in 1848-1851. He served as a colonel in the Saxon army, and later became a lieutenant general. In 1854, Prince Albert succeeded his brother Ernst as the Duke of Saxe-Altenburg. During his reign, he focused on developing the local economy and infrastructure, and initiated several major building projects in the region. He was also a major patron of the arts and culture, and supported many local artists and musicians. Prince Albert died on 6 February 1902 in Altenburg, at the age of 83.
